Great choice! Humpback Rocks is a beautiful hike and definitely provides a challenge. Here are some tips for hiking in the Charlottesville area:

1. Wear appropriate clothing and footwear: Make sure to wear sturdy, comfortable shoes or boots with good traction, and dress in layers so you can adjust your clothing as needed. Bring a rain jacket or other waterproof gear if rain is in the forecast.

2. Bring plenty of water and snacks: It's important to stay hydrated while hiking, so be sure to bring plenty of water. In addition, bring some snacks or energy bars to keep you fueled on the trail.

3. Check weather and trail conditions: Always check the weather before you head out, and check the trail conditions to make sure it is safe for hiking. Some trails may be closed or difficult to navigate depending on the weather.

4. Plan your route: Know your route and how long it will take, and make sure to allow yourself enough time to complete it before dark or bad weather rolls in. It is also a good idea to tell someone where you are going and when you expect to return.

5. Leave no trace: It is important to respect the natural environment and leave no trace. Pack out all your trash and avoid disturbing wildlife or damaging plants.

Remember to take your time and enjoy the scenery, and be respectful of other hikers on the trail. Have a great time hiking in Charlottesville!
